smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function tryBeat is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function render is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function create is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function runGame is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class Player is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class GameScreen is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class PlayerTesting is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function handValue appears to be too complex.
The function throwOrDone appears to be too complex.
The function tryBeat appears to be too complex.
The function sortCards appears to be too complex.
The function render appears to be too complex.
The function endTurn appears to be too complex.
The function tintCards appears to be too complex.
The function handle appears to be too complex.
The function drawCardsToPlayer appears to be too complex.
The function render appears to be too complex.
The function render appears to be too complex.
The function create appears to be too complex.
The function step appears to be too complex.
The function endTurn appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'Player' with '19' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'GameScreen' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.

smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function render is nested too deeply.

Function main is nested too deeply.

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: SpreadOperator
smells.description: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (deuceBeatsAce && thisRankValue == 0 && otherRankValue == 12) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: deuceBeatsAce && thisRankValue == 0 && otherRankValue == 12
Parentheses in (relativeCardValue(r.value)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: relativeCardValue(r.value)
Parentheses in (rankValue + maxValue - 14) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: rankValue + maxValue - 14

Parentheses in (outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }

Parentheses in (if (ruleSet.loweredFirstDiscardLimit
                        && discardPile.isEmpty())
                    DEAL_LIMIT else DEAL_LIMIT - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (ruleSet.loweredFirstDiscardLimit
                        && discardPile.isEmpty())
                    DEAL_LIMIT else DEAL_LIMIT - 1
Parentheses in (playerTook && currentAttackerIndex == currentDefenderIndex) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: playerTook && currentAttackerIndex == currentDefenderIndex
Parentheses in (Gdx.graphics.width / 800f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Gdx.graphics.width / 800f
Parentheses in (Gdx.graphics.height / 480f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Gdx.graphics.height / 480f
Parentheses in (playerIndex == 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: playerIndex == 0

Parentheses in (outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }
Parentheses in (attackCards[it] != null) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: attackCards[it] != null
Parentheses in (playerIndex == 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: playerIndex == 0
Parentheses in (360f + 90f * index) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 360f + 90f * index
Parentheses in (playerCount > 2 && playerCount % 2 == 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: playerCount > 2 && playerCount % 2 == 0
Parentheses in (playerCount > 2 && playerCount % 2 == 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: playerCount > 2 && playerCount % 2 == 0
Parentheses in (cardCount / 4) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: cardCount / 4

Parentheses in (outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }

Parentheses in (outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: outOfPlay.map { if (it) 0 else 1 }.fold(initial = 0) { total, current -> total + current }

Parentheses in (if (ruleSet.loweredFirstDiscardLimit
                        && discardPile.isEmpty())
                    DEAL_LIMIT else DEAL_LIMIT - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (ruleSet.loweredFirstDiscardLimit
                        && discardPile.isEmpty())
                    DEAL_LIMIT else DEAL_LIMIT - 1
Parentheses in (playerTook && currentAttackerIndex == currentDefenderIndex) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: playerTook && currentAttackerIndex == currentDefenderIndex

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
